title: Ukraine tycoon Ihor Kolomoisky taken into custody over fraud allegations
description: Court places billionaire businessman under arrest for two months over fraud and money laundering charges.

title: Indian police condemn BBC for article on press freedom in Kashmir
description: Police in disputed Kashmir region threaten legal action against the broadcaster for reporting on media crackdown.

title: How is France and Niger’s standoff likely to end?
description: Tensions rising as French President Emmanual Macron refuses to recognise coup.

title: Curfew imposed in Iraq’s Kirkuk after rival protests turn deadly
description: At least one civilian killed as Kurds, Arabs hold demonstrations sparked by handover of local security HQ to Kurds.

title: US mum who gave parenting advice on YouTube charged with child abuse
description: Founder of defunct channel 8 Passengers Ruby Franke and her business partner arrested this week.

title: Nobel Foundation reverses invitations to Russia, Iran after backlash
description: Decision to invite representatives from Russia and Iran to awards ceremony criticised over Ukraine war, rights abuses.

title: Dozens of people injured in clashes between rival Eritrean groups in Israel
description: Supporters and critics of Eritrean government engage in violent clashes at a pro-government event in Tel Aviv.

title: Prigozhin’s life and death exposed the rot in the Russian state
description: Russia's compromised political system, which led to the Wagner Group's mutiny, will continue to pose a risk for Putin.

title: Niger coup supporters call for France ambassador, troops to leave country
description: Protesters rally outside a French military base calling for the ambassador and about 1,500 soldiers to leave.

title: Two Chinese among 4 killed in attack on DRC gold convoy
description: South Kivu is the scene of attacks staged by armed groups and there has been violence between locals and Chinese miners.

title: ‘More than basketball’: South Sudan go from underdogs to history-makers
description: South Sudan have made history by winning their first FIBA World Cup game and by qualifying for the Paris 2024 Olympics.

title: Pakistan traders hold nationwide shutdown over electricity bills, inflation
description: Closures in major cities with shops displaying placards decrying 'unreasonable increase in electricity bills and taxes'.

title: Sixteen pilgrims killed in Iraq road accident during religious gathering
description: Carnage on Iraq's highways often occurs during the Arbaeen religious event as millions flock to the city of Karbala.

title: Performer Jimmy Buffett dies at 76: ‘He lived his life like a song’
description: Best known for the 1977 song Margaritaville, it quickly took on a life of its own and became a 'a profound meditation'.

title: Gabon coup leader: No rush to elections and ‘the same mistakes’
description: The coup - West and Central Africa's eighth in three years - drew cheering crowds onto the streets.

title: Ryyan Alshebl: From Syrian refugee to mayor of a German town
description: The 29-year-old who fled war in Syria eight years ago shares his journey from being a refugee to mayor of Ostelsheim.

title: As China’s economy stumbles, should the rest of the world worry?
description: China has recorded a series of weak economic data in the past six months.

title: The Nigerian rapper with a coat of many colours
description: The popular Nigerian rapper was a late bloomer but has since come into his own and made an impact in multiple fields.

title: Russia says Ukraine sea drones destroyed in failed attack on Crimea bridge
description: One naval drone was destroyed late on Friday and two others early on Saturday morning, Russia’s defence ministry says.

title: Mohamed al-Fayed, whose son died in crash with Princess Diana, dies at 94
description: Billionaire businessman Mohamed al-Fayed remained convinced his son, Dodi, and Diana were victims of a conspiracy.

title: Analysis: Fallout from Israel meeting shows militia power in Libya
description: The outcome of the meeting between Israel and Libya's foreign ministers is a weakened Libyan PM, and stronger militias.

title: After moon landing, India sends new space mission to observe sun
description: Latest mission by Indian Space Research Organisation will send a probe 1.5 million km to study the sun's outer layers.

title: Typhoon Saola makes landfall on China’s coast after slamming Hong Kong
description: Super Typhoon Saola weakens after making landfall on southern China's Guangdong coast after pummelling Hong Kong.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 556
description: As the war enters its 556th day, these are the main developments.

title: Russia puts advanced Sarmat nuclear missile system on ‘combat duty’
description: Russian space agency chief Yuri Borisov says new intercontinental ballistic missile system is now in service: Reports.

title: North Korea fires cruise missiles towards Yellow Sea: South Korean military
description: Missile launches come as South Korean and US forces conclude joint military exercises on Korean Peninsula.

title: Latest bridge bombing in Ecuador underscores grip of criminal gangs
description: Officials have framed the string of explosions as backlash to efforts to regain control of Ecuador's embattled prisons.
